verses.kjv: Thinkest thou this to be right, that thou saidst, My righteousness is more than Godâ€™s?
verses.ct: "Do you really think you're justified in claiming that your righteousness is greater than God's?

verses.kjv: For thou saidst, What advantage will it be unto thee? and, What profit shall I have, if I be cleansed from my sin?
verses.ct: Because you asked, 'What good does it do me? What do I gain by avoiding sin?'

verses.kjv: I will answer thee, and thy companions with thee.
verses.ct: I'll respond to you, and to your friends along with you.

verses.kjv: Look unto the heavens, and see; and behold the clouds which are higher than thou.
verses.ct: Look up at the heavens and observe them; consider the clouds, so far above you.

verses.kjv: If thou sinnest, what doest thou against him? or if thy transgressions be multiplied, what doest thou unto him?
verses.ct: If you sin, how does that affect God? Even if your offenses pile up, what does that do to him?

verses.kjv: If thou be righteous, what givest thou him? or what receiveth he of thine hand?
verses.ct: If you live righteously, what are you giving him? What does he receive from you?

verses.kjv: Thy wickedness may hurt a man as thou art; and thy righteousness may profit the son of man.
verses.ct: Your wickedness only impacts other people like yourself, and your righteousness only benefits other human beings.

verses.kjv: By reason of the multitude of oppressions they make the oppressed to cry: they cry out by reason of the arm of the mighty.
verses.ct: People groan under the weight of heavy oppression; they cry out for relief from the power of the ruthless.

verses.kjv: But none saith, Where is God my maker, who giveth songs in the night;
verses.ct: But no one asks, 'Where is God my maker, the one who provides songs in the darkest hours,

verses.kjv: Who teacheth us more than the beasts of the earth, and maketh us wiser than the fowls of heaven?
verses.ct: who teaches us more than the animals of the earth and makes us wiser than the birds of the heavens?'

verses.kjv: There they cry, but none giveth answer, because of the pride of evil men.
verses.ct: They cry out, but God doesn't answer, because of the arrogance of those evil people.

verses.kjv: Surely God will not hear vanity, neither will the Almighty regard it.
verses.ct: God certainly won't listen to empty complaints, and the Almighty won't pay attention to them.

verses.kjv: Although thou sayest thou shalt not see him, yet judgment is before him; therefore trust thou in him.
verses.ct: How much less when you say you can't see him! Your case is still before him, so wait for him.

verses.kjv: But now, because it is not so, he hath visited in his anger; yet he knoweth it not in great extremity:
verses.ct: But now, because his anger has not yet punished severely, Job thinks God doesn't notice extreme defiance.

verses.kjv: Therefore doth Job open his mouth in vain; he multiplieth words without knowledge.
verses.ct: So Job speaks with nothing to back it up; he piles up words without understanding."
